column4: Can I mount DMG files directly inside Linux? I am trying to mount DMG files which are actually FAT32 from my camcorder, they esixt on a HFSPLUS partiion on an external drive.
i think it may be able to read hfs, but im not sure about hfs+
I can view the HFS partition just fine but when I try to mount the DMG file using mount -t hfsplus -o loop <filename.dmg> I get an error "wrong fs type..."
if you mean your apt 'cache'   - apt-get autoclean cleans the cache.. remove - will remove packlages flagged as not needed any more
both sould be 'safe' commands
thx
Do you know where they are stored, so I can see how much space they are using?
just chmod +x winetricks then use ./winetricks whatever
and if its in /usr/bin/winetricks you dont 'sh winetricks' you would 'winetricks whatver'
i  always keep the latest copy of winetricks in my .wine/ dir.
I was just following instructions at http://wiki.winehq.org/winetricks
you missunderstood them
they are for when you download winetricks and its int he current dir
Okay, I downloaded wine through the package manager
when i do the chmod +x winetricks I get 'chmod: cannot access `winetricks': No such file or directory'
time to check some bash guides on 'output redirection'
ahh, gotcha, basically files vs commands
theres most likely a way to do it in the ccsm plugins. ive used to do things that way. but been a long time.
what do you do know instead?
err.. middle click in the title bar.. does send it to back here...
gotcha,
ccsm has more settings then i can discover. it has a search feature that may do it.
not installed by default
